abstract.p: The village headman (muqaddam) Pir Sethi gave a loan of 680 rupees to another headman with the latter's headmanship serving as guarantee of repayment within three years. After the indebted headman died and a period of famine and enemy attacks resulted in the depopulation of the village, it was decided in the presence of a judge (qazi) and the notables of the district (pargana) that with the consent of the deceased's surviving relations, the headmanship should be placed in Pir Sethi's possession.

باعث تحریر این سطور آنکه پیر سیتهی مقدم موضع کرب گانون پرگنه اکالکوت صوبه محمد آباد عرف ظفر آباد
بحضور ارباب عدالت و اهالی و موالی پرگنه افضل پور صوبه مزبور آمده ظاهر نمود که مسمی ملپا مقدم
اندیواری پرگنه افضل پور در عیوض مبلغ ۶ ششصد و هشتاد روپیه در هنگامی که پید نایک موضع مزبور در قبض
خود داشت از ما گرفته بگماشته نایک مزبور رسانیده در گروی ملپا مذکور مقدمی با وجه لوازم و رسوم
با اراضی انعام موضع مسطور تمسک بمیعاد ۳ سه ساله بعلامت و دستخط زمینداران پرگنه مزبور نوشته داده که
درینمدت زر را بوصول رسانم اگر بوعده زر واصل نسازم مقدمی با لوازم و مراسم و اراضی دست بر دارم و
چنانچه میعاد مقضی شد و ملپا مزبور مطابق وعده بوصول برساند و ملپا مقدم مزبور فوت شد
و قحط سال گردید و مدت نه سال دیه مسطور از سبب رفت قحطی و فتور غنیم لئیم ویران گشت
بنده مطابق تمسک از شریک مقدم و برادران مقدم مزبور زر را بقاضای نمود
آنها گفتند که ملپا مقدم قربه مزبور در حین حیات خود تمسک بشرح و میعاد که بمن داده
مایان نیز بمضمون آن راضی وشا کرانیم مقدمی وعده با لوازمه مقرری قربه مسطور در قبض و تصرف
خود نماید مایان را هیچوجه ازینمعنی تعین و مزاحمت نیست و نداریم بنابران مطابق تمسک و اقرار
شريک پتل و برادران مقمم مزبور و ارباب عدالت و اهالی و موالی دست ناطق میخواهم که
ثانی الحال سند ناطق بما و اولاد و احفاد من و تفصیل مفصل در هندوی مرقوم است هر که
ازینمعنی واقف باشد دستخط و شاهدی بر این قرطاس شب نماید لهذا این چند کلمه بطریق محضر قلمی گشت تحریر فی التاریخ چهارم ۴ شوال سنه ۴ جلوس

The reason for the writing of these lines is that Pir Sethi, muqaddam of the village Kadabgaon in pargana Akkalkot in suba Muhammadabad, or Zaffarabad,
in the presence of the notables of the court and all the people of the pargana Afzalpur in the aforementioned suba came and announced that the muqaddam named Malappa
of Andewadi in pargana Afzalpur took the sum of 6 six hundred and eighty rupees at the time that Pid Nayak had the aforementioned village
in his possession, and the agent of the aforementioned Nayak delivered it, and in mortgaging of the aforementioned Malappa’s muqaddami along with the requisite fees and perquisites
and the inʿam lands of the aforementioned village, a tamassuk for a period of 3 three years with the marks and signatures of the landlords of the aforementioned pargana was written that
in this period, the money would be delivered to me. If by [this] promise the money did not reach me, I would assume the muqaddami with the requisite fees and perquisites. And
accordingly the period elapsed. And the aforementioned Malappa according to the promise should have paid. And Malappa the aforementioned muqaddam died.
And a year of famine took place. And in a period of nine years, the aforementioned village became depopulated because of flight from famine and the disorder of the cursed enemy.
The slave [I] according to the tamassuk summoned the partner of the muqaddam as well as the brother of the aforementioned muqaddam to the qazi.
They said that [as] the muqaddam Malappa of the aforementioned village in his own lifetime gave a tamassuk with a statement and a period [of payment] to me,
we also by the contents of that will acquiesce [to your claim].
The promised muqaddami with the fixed perquisites of the aforementioned village should be placed in [your] own control and possession. There is no obstruction or issue to us from this event and we shall not have [such a problem]. On account of this, in accordance with the tamassuk and iqrar,
the associate of the patil and the brother of the aforementioned muqaddam and the notables of the court and all the people willed decisively that
henceforth a decisive sanad to me and my descendants and relations with the particulars should be written in Hindvi. Whoever
should become aware of this event may see the signatures and testimonies on this paper. Therefore these few words in the form of a mahzar were written. Written on the date fourth 4 Shawwal in the fourth year of the reign.

Mahzar in the presence of all the people of the pargana Muhammadnagar,
or Bagwadi, chakla Akkalkot, in the suba Muhammadabad in the Suhur year 1125,
or the Shaka [year] 1637, or the Manmatha year, in Ashwin on the first day [of the lunar fortnight],
Monday. The completed mahzar is as follows, because previously Malappa, the muqaddam
of the village Andewadi in the aforementioned pargana took a loan from Pir Sethi,
[and] because [during the] confusion the agent of Pid Nayak came before the subadar
of the government, stayed in the aforementioned village, and dunned the village for money.
On account of this, in the year 1113 a loan of the sum of 680 rupees [fractional symbol],
[or] six hundred and eighty, was taken from Pir Sethi, and under the supervision of the panchayat,
a katba was given. So that a promise for three years was made. Should the aforementioned money
not be received as promised, my own [Malappa’s] heritable rights to the muqaddami together with the fees and perquisites
and residence and fields and anything related to the inʿam have been voluntarily
given. Thus on the basis of the testimony of the panchayat, a katba
having been given, the aforementioned village became fully depopulated. Because of famine
and the disorder of the enemy, its land and property was wasted. Malappa
having died, then Pir Sethi came to the aforementioned pargana
and in the presence of the notables and the court and the deshmukhs and the deshpandes declared
that on the basis of the katba, a loan to Malappa, the muqaddam of the village Andewadi,
is to be given. Hence my own loan from the muqaddam of the aforementioned village
ought to be given so happened. Then the aforementioned village’s
Bagli Patel and the brothers of Malappa were summoned,
and questioned. That the aforementioned loan of Pir Sethi’s that is to be given
should be given, an order was made, and afterwards, Bagli Patel and the brothers
of the aforementioned Malappa announced that Malappa when alive took the money and has given
his heritable rights. We have become utterly impoverished in giving [back] the money to you.
On the basis of the katba, so as [to give] the muqaddami of the aforementioned village to Pir Sethi,
we come willingly, so [they] announced. Then by way of custom,
justice was done. Towards the aforementioned money, the muqaddami of the aforementioned village
and fees and perquisites and fields and inʿam and dwelling and place, all of the notables
of the court and the deshmukhs and deshpandes and all of the people having assembled
Malappa’s muqaddami in the aforementioned village and all the fees and perquisites
and dwelling and place [and] fields [and] inʿam have been given to Pir Sethi. Now the village
is depopulated. So for the enhancement of his inʿam lands,
chavar 1/4, or one quarter, has been given. Pir Sethi [shall have] the muqaddami of the aforementioned village
in inʿam, in total both previously and currently chavar ; so much the hakims and deshmukhs
and deshpandes have assembled and given. Therefore Pir Sethi [shall have] the muqaddami of the aforementioned village
[under] the sun and moon. And from generation to generation he shall enjoy the muqaddami and fees and perquisites
happily and ensure the cultivation and revenue collection of the village, and the children of his children
should abide and reside on the village-land steadily and attend to
the government’s work. [Comprising] the aforementioned village’s previous inʿam and current inʿam,
the inʿam monies of the total chavar should be exempt from the court’s taxation,
and on the remaining lands of the aforementioned village, grants of revenue should be distributed, statements [of revenue] calculated,
and the inʿam given to Pir Sethi, the muqaddam of the village Andewadi.
The aforementioned pargana’s hakims and deshmukhs and deshpandes and muqaddams of the villages of the aforementioned pargana
have acquiesced and conferred a sanad-mahzar on Pir Sethi, the muqaddam of the aforementioned village.
In future if anyone should challenge the mahzar-sanad,
for the turbaned people [Muslims] it will be as if [making] an oath to God is [the same as]
contradicting an oath, and for Hindu people, it will be as if going to Kashi and dying
is equal to a sin. Currently, [regarding] the rights to grain in the aforementioned village, from each khandi [of] mung, [fractional symbol] 1 one
has been given as a perquisite. And [regarding] the Mahars and servants who are never
far from the muqaddam, 1 Mahar should remain. And on the Julahis and Dhangars,
in the late crop-season of each year only 3 three rupees and on the transit of gunny-sacks, from each gunny
[fractional symbol] 3 three only rukas should be taken. The currently given mahzar is right. Approved by mahzar.
Approved on the 14th of the month of Shawwal.
